stem: The nurse is caring for a client who is one day post-operative following a lumbar laminectomy. Which of the following nursing actions are essential for this client's care? Select all that apply.

options.text: Elevate the head of the bed to 60 degrees.
Assess lower extremity sensation and movement.
Limit fluid intake to 1000 mL per day.
Encourage coughing and deep breathing exercises.

rationale.correct: Maintaining proper body alignment prevents complications and promotes healing. Logrolling the client ensures the spine remains aligned during turning. Assessing lower extremity sensation and movement detects neurological deficits. Administering pain medication promotes comfort and facilitates participation in care. Encouraging coughing and deep breathing prevents respiratory complications.
rationale.mnemonic: ALL- Pain: Alignment, Logroll, Lower extremity assessment, Pain meds
rationale.incorrect: Elevating the head of the bed more than 30 degrees can cause strain on the surgical site. Massaging the lower back is contraindicated as it can disrupt the surgical site. Limiting fluid intake can lead to constipation and dehydration. Discouraging movement can lead to complications such as pneumonia and deep vein thrombosis.
rationale.questionTrap: Students may select options that are generally good nursing practices but are contraindicated or less important in the immediate post-operative period following a lumbar laminectomy.
clinicalPearls: Following lumbar laminectomy, maintaining spinal alignment is crucial to prevent complications.
Neurological assessments are essential to detect any post-operative deficits.

itemContext.sbar: John Smith is a 55-year-old male, one day post-operative lumbar laminectomy. He reports pain at the surgical site. Vital signs are stable. He is able to move his lower extremities.
